settings.text:
The chance to make something that was 100% my own, with every decision and
aspect of the winemaking coming purely from my actions. Having had the
opportunity to work with some great winemakers over the last seven years, both
here in Australia (Hunter Valley and Tasmania, both the Tamar and the Derwent)
and in the USA, I’ve learnt many different methods and seen the benefits of
certain techniques. While adopting some of these and incorporating my own
ideas, I was able to identify the types of wines that I was interested in making
and that I would be proud to put my name to as examples of balanced
winemaking. Wine for me is something tangible, something for people to enjoy.
I’m not artistic, but making wine seems to be a combination of science and art
which suits my background in forensic chemistry.
